result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. CHRIS R SHERLIN

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Atty Ceman called to request a new court date as he is in trial on the 11/29 date. Rescheduled to December 5, 2022 at 3:00 PM.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 29, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Pretrial Status Report
Proposed Order Granting Request to File an Amended Information
to Amend the Information

8:33 AM Defendant CHRIS R SHERLIN in court.  Attorney Scott A Ceman in court for CHRIS R SHERLIN.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Ceman requests to proceed with the prelim. State has one witness.

Lucas Meyer sworn, direct by ADA McElroy, is employed for the Berlin Police Department. Was employed on the date in question. Testimony given. Venue established.  Defendant identified in the court room. Continued testimony. Cross exam by Atty Ceman. No re-direct by ADA McElroy. No other witnesses or evidence by the State or the defense. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court - it mirrors the criminal complaint. Attorney Ceman and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Ceman enters a plea of Not Guilty on all counts on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date November 7, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 8:49 AM
Return date scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return date on November 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:06 AM Defendant CHRIS R SHERLIN in court.  Attorney Scott A Ceman in court for CHRIS R SHERLIN.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court notes bond has been set. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. 

Court adjourned at 10:07 AM

Court will set for Preliminary Hearing on August 19, 2022 at 8:30 AM.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
to Adjourn

NOT ON THE RECORD:

Defendant appears via zoom, in custody and without counsel, from the Green Lake County Jail. Matthew McElroy appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. Court has reviewed the probable cause statement. ADA makes bond request. You may be randomly tested for compliance. Court sets for Initial Appearance on July 19, 2022 at 9:30 a.m.
